Adding a Server Configuration

You and your team members can access one or more server configurations. If you have more than one server configuration running on the same computer, however, each configuration must use a unique protocol and port combination.

Before you access a configuration, you must add it to the list of available configurations on your workstation by entering its  computer name or IP address and endpoint. This information allows the server to be located.

Managing server access includes adding, deleting, or modifying the server configuration properties. You can accomplish these tasks as part of creating or opening a project or from the Server Administration dialog.

To add a new server configuration:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • Click New Project on the toolbar. The New Project Wizard dialog opens.

    • Click Open Project  on the toolbar. The Open Project Wizard dialog opens.

    • On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server. Alternatively, from the client, you can select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name > Server Administration (available with custom installations only). These actions display the Server Administration dialog.

  2. Do one of the following:

    • On the New Project Wizard or Open Project Wizard, click the Add Server button. The Add Server dialog opens.

    • On the Server Administration dialog, click the Add Server icon or select Server > Add Server.

    These actions display the Add Server dialog.

  3. Enter a descriptive name in the Server Description text box. This server name should be unique. It is case-insensitive and cannot contain colons (:).

  4. Enter or browse for the address in the Server Address text box. The address is the computer name or IP address.

  5. Enter the required information in the TCP/IP Endpoint text box. The endpoint is the port number The default is 49201.

  6. Select the Compress Transferred Data check box, if desired.

  7. To enable Encryption, select an encryption check box. Encryption protects files and other project information from being read by unauthorized parties over unsecured network lines. You must use at least the minimum level of encryption set for a specific server configuration; however, you can select a higher level of encryption, if you prefer.

  8. (Optional) If you are using StarTeamMPX and do not want to use the default profile:

    1. Click MPX Message Broker to open the Profiles dialog.

    2. Select a profile.

    3. If desired, click Properties to review the selected profile’s properties.

    4. Click Set to use the selected profile as your MPX Message Broker profile.

    5. Click Set.

    6. Click Close.

  • From the Add Server dialog, click OK. If you started with the New Project Wizard dialog or the Open Project Wizard dialog, that dialog reopens. If you started with the Server Administration dialog, that dialog reopens.
